Peter Parker.Action: Swings skillfully across the city skyline using webbing; performs a precise slingshot maneuver to catapult himself over the Empire State Building.
Appears confident and agile in his Spider-Man abilities as shown by his smooth navigation and high-risk moves.
Gets fired by J. Jonah Jameson despite having good photos, indicating possible lack of workplace competence or interpersonal issues.
Refuses to sell a great Spider-Man photo to JJJ unless he agrees to more balanced coverage of Spider-Man.
Pleads with JJJ not to fire him because he struggles to pay tuition and support Aunt May.
Relents to JJJ's mocking gesture without retaliation.
Prioritizes Spider-Man's positive image over personal financial gain.
Apologizes sincerely to Mr. Aziz for being late and takes on responsibility to deliver pizzas despite difficulties.
Rushes to deliver pizzas to help Mr. Aziz, showing consideration for his employer's plight.
Snaps out of a distracted state upon realizing the time and rushes to fulfill his delivery duties.
Struggles with an unreliable bike to complete a critical timed pizza delivery.
Despite previous doubts expressed by Mr. Aziz, accepts responsibility to deliver seventeen pizzas within a tight deadline.
Letting go of a photo after realizing he made a mistake suggests a moment of self-doubt or lack of confidence.
Stops his bike to avoid hitting an old lady in a wheelchair, then acts quickly to remove the hotbox and avoid danger.
Swings in as Spider-Man to save two boys about to be hit by a car, using his web to rescue them safely.
Kicks the bike repeatedly until it starts despite initial failure.
Immediately halts to observe an escalating conflict between drivers, showing awareness.
Swerves to avoid an old lady in a wheelchair, demonstrating quick reflexes and concern, but stalls the bike.
Wrenches the hotbox off the bike forcefully, causing damage but quickly removes the obstacle.
Spider-Man uses spider sense to detect danger and successfully saves two boys from being hit by a car with skillful web use.
Sheepishly scrapes webbing off the pizza box and apologizes to the receptionist.
Earnestly pleads with Mr. Aziz for another chance at his job, expressing that the promise matters to him as well.
Immediately apologizes to the security goon after accidentally hurting him.
Reacts defensively and confusedly to being stopped and asked for ID, showing no hostility but slight frustration.
Arrives with pizzas late, with webbing stuck on a pizza box, apologizes sheepishly.
Petitions his employer for another chance after getting fired, but loses his job.
Manages to quickly detect and physically overpower a security goon in a surprise confrontation using agile moves.
Is puzzled by the card reader entrance at home and surprised by security protocols, revealing some lack of awareness.
Expresses worry and concern about Harry's paranoia.
Struggles and ultimately fails to meet Harry's searching gaze, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Responds to Harry's defensive and tense behavior with calmness and attempts to reassure him.
Uses a slender hybrid PDA/remote to trigger multiple high-tech security measures including titanium bars, steel shutters, laser trip-beams, and a retinal scan to gain access.
Flinches at the retinal scan, showing some hesitation or discomfort with high-tech security.
Struggles to convincingly deny Harry the method by which he finds 'the guy'; fails to fully meet Harry's gaze, indicating some difficulty maintaining deception.
Maintains a calm and concerned demeanor with Harry, changing the subject skillfully and managing a tense conversation with humor.
Encourages Harry to come to the lecture despite their tension, tries to keep his promise and plans to support Mary Jane by going to her show.
Dismisses Harry's teasing about Mary Jane and denies being her boyfriend, maintaining a polite boundary without hostility.
Leaps into danger to stop the out-of-control rig and protect Otto and others.
Kneels beside Otto to make sure he's okay after stopping the rig.
Gets out of the way to let the team assist Otto and handle the situation.
Spider-Man leaps into the middle of the cyclone, efficiently uses web snares to immobilize the rogue pods, then improvises by tying and cocooning them to safely disable the rig and save Otto.
After disabling the rig, Spider-Man ensures Otto is okay by kneeling beside him before letting others assist, showing situational awareness and care.
Accepts introduction to Otto courteously, expresses enthusiasm about the Rig and interest in superspider research.
Politely responds to Otto's invitation to be informal, showing friendliness and respect.
Mentions his interest in spider research as 'sort of a hobby,' indicating modesty and sincerity.
Politely introduces himself to Otto and engages in conversation about advanced scientific research, showing interest and social ease.
Refers to his interest in spiders as 'sort of a hobby', which may downplay his knowledge or seriousness.
Prioritizes attending Mary Jane's musical debut despite his busy schedule.
Encourages Otto to check out the musical, showing friendly inclusiveness.
Remembers Mary Jane's important debut and rushes to be there on time despite prior engagement
Engages politely and encourages Otto to check out the play, showing social confidence
Tries to enter theater during performance to support Mary Jane despite rules, showing concern for a friend.
Insists on entering the theater after the performance has begun despite clear rules, showing persistence but not respecting boundaries or rules.
Approaches the situation with urgency and determination, demonstrating commitment to helping MJ.
Spider-Man flies elegantly through the gunfire, quickly neutralizes the shooters by pinning them to light posts for police.
Considers ignoring the car chase, rationalizing 'It's not your problem, Pete. It's the police's problem.' but ultimately intervenes.
Rescues two people just before a car explodes at a construction site.
Stops falling to prevent hitting twins in a stroller, despite personal injury.
Does not engage or escalate when verbally harassed and threatened by a crowd.
Responds calmly and resignedly to policemen saying he will be arrested.
Gives chase to MJ after she tries to avoid him; insists on talking and wants to be friends despite her rejection.
Misses the theater performance and lies to MJ to explain his absence, unable to provide a convincing excuse.
Apologizes to MJ and expresses desire to be her friend sincerely.
Shows vulnerability and emotional openness when admitting how much he thinks about MJ.
Respectfully gives MJ space when she is angry and does not push her beyond comfort.
Puts Aunt May's needs before his own (stops advancing with MJ to take Aunt May's call).
Shows sensitivity and genuine concern toward MJ, tries to apologize and mend their relationship.
Seems unsure and embarrassed when his pager goes off at a critical emotional moment.
Responds quickly and responsibly when Aunt May calls, showing attentiveness and care.
Uses his spider-sharp hearing to locate the annoying fly in Aunt May's bedroom quickly and accurately.
Immediately takes action to resolve Aunt May's distress by dealing with the fly efficiently.
Responds calmly and supportively to Aunt May's emotional distress.
Admits to having difficulty mourning and shows guilt about Uncle Ben’s death.
Is reluctant to open up emotionally to Aunt May despite her encouragement.
Expresses remorse for not stopping the criminal earlier, acknowledging his responsibility.
Admits to himself and Aunt May that he failed to stop the criminal who later killed Uncle Ben because he didn't see it as his problem at the time.
Acknowledges the emotional weight and difficulty of grieving, showing self-awareness about his struggles but expresses inability to mourn properly.
Attempts to help Aunt May pick up the broken china but is pushed away and respects her wish for space.
Responds to the motorcycle fire by quickly leaping off and attempting to extinguish the flames with his spider strength, though somewhat ineffectively.
Expresses frustration over repeated failures as the motorcycle bursts into flames and he cannot cross town reliably.
Begs Harry to let him in and shows vulnerability by admitting he is a wreck.
Declines Harry's offer of a drink out of concern for Harry's health and medication.
Sits beside Harry and listens to him, showing patience and support.
Refuses to disclose Norman Osborn's whereabouts to Harry despite pressure, out of concern for safety.
Insists on not drinking alcohol despite being offered martinis while under stress.
Recognizes and addresses the danger of the situation involving Harry's contacts and the bounty on someone.
Expresses hesitation and inability to reconnect with a key figure due to danger.
Does not immediately act on the information about the bounty/reward and murder implications.
Insists on moving out and not being a freeloader despite financial hardship and offers of help from Harry.
Refuses to impose on Harry even though he has nowhere else to go.
Is honest with Harry about his job loss and inability to pay rent.
Uses his spider-sense to detect a gunshot and react attentively to a nearby threat.
Successfully scales a wall with agility and confidence.
Webs and disarms multiple armed muggers quickly to protect frightened elderly victims.
Thanks the grocer sincerely after being given money back, showing respect and humility.
Allows the grocer to defend him against the young men despite being attacked, not retaliating aggressively.
Pins a thug quickly and effectively using webbing, disarms multiple attackers in seconds, and recovers stolen money.
Gets hit in the head by a watermelon thrown unexpectedly, causing him to wobble and sag.
Maintains composure after getting hit and promptly escapes before police arrive.
Misjudges the reaction of the old ladies after saving them, resulting in them bludgeoning him with handbags.
Slaps webbing across JJJ's mouth and encases him in webbing to stop him from speaking.
Shows restraint by releasing JJJ after confronting him on the ledge, allowing him to retreat safely.
Engages in sarcastic banter about JJJ's fear of heights but expresses frustration about JJJ's reckless actions potentially getting him killed.
Leaps to safety from a crowd attacking him, demonstrating physical agility and situational awareness.
Surprises J. Jonah Jameson by breaking into the newsroom through the skylight, showing boldness and creative problem solving.
Quickly subdues JJJ by webbing him up efficiently and restraining him completely, demonstrating control and skill.
Uses humor and taunts JJJ while restraining him, indicating confidence and psychological insight.
Removes the cocoon from JJJ carefully to prevent injury while maintaining control of the situation.
Confronts JJJ directly about his hatred and slander with a calm but firm attitude.
Leaps away silently rather than engaging aggressively with JJJ's insults and accusations.
Packs up belongings and moves out quietly without confrontation or complaint.
Shrugs off Harry's offer to do laundry at his place, wanting to manage on his own.
Stops a young man from using his laundry machine, calmly explains it's his machine, and waits to fix the issue after the man leaves.
Senses the man trying to use his laundry machine before it happens and warns him to stop.
Identifies that the laundry machine is out of balance, retrieves his soaking wet suit promptly.
Sends encouraging flowers to MJ to support her after a poor performance.
Waits outside MJ's apartment with a single rose, showing hopeful intent and affection.
Leaves silently when MJ and Otto approach, choosing not to confront or interrupt.
Observes MJ kiss Otto with a broken heart, showing emotional sensitivity and vulnerability.
Arrives on time, dressed up with a rose, showing initiative and effort to meet MJ.
Misses MJ and Otto arriving, evidenced by him not being present when they get to the building despite hearing footsteps and voices.
Clings upside down to the side of the building, holding a rose and watching silently, showing a passive, non-intervening stance.
Sits down and buries his face in his hands, chokes up reflecting on his spider bite and past events.
Creeps down the hall cautiously outside the lab, watching Otto with concern.
Approaches Otto to talk, greeted with suspicion but remains calm and polite.
Curiously but non-accusatorily questions Otto about the recreational use of the 'pods.
Engages in a serious scientific conversation with Otto, showing trust and openness.
Uses visual voice-stress analysis to scan Otto's words, indicating distrust or suspicion.
Steps out of the shadows to confront Otto directly and ask pointed questions about the arbovirus and its effects.
Uses a subtle lie or deflection ('just curious') to mask his true intentions and avoid raising suspicion.
Watches Otto carefully and notes the behavioral cues and environment (pods reacting to sound, eyeing pods warily).
Allows Otto to keep some information vague and ambiguous instead of pressing aggressively or demanding clear answers at once.
Refuses to reveal much personal information about Spider-Man to Otto and downplays their relationship, calling him 'not a friend' and describing him dismissively to Otto.
Shows reluctance and discomfort when discussing Spider-Man's disfigurement and mask, indicating nervousness but also a lack of empathy.
Plays off Otto's questions awkwardly and avoids giving clear answers about Spider-Man's condition.
Gathers information about Otto’s parity chip and attempts to understand the technology being presented.
Responds politely and agrees with Otto's positive comment about Mary Jane.
Tries to appear nonchalant when buying supplies to help his spider abilities, showing sincerity in pursuing his challenges.
Uses webbing to ingeniously retrieve the baggie from the tray via the airvent without waking Otto.
Attempts to appear nonchalant while buying veterinary supplies for spider treatment, maintaining composure despite potential embarrassment.
Prepares a workspace by clearing his tiny desk to work on his project methodically.
Responds to Ditkovich's concern with impatience and haste.
Performs careful, meticulous scientific procedure on himself, showing self-care.
Reflects bitterly on his isolation and suffering, expressing emotional pain but not reaching out for help.
Remembers Uncle Ben's teachings about responsibility, showing sincere internalization of moral values.
Expresses resentment and self-pity, calling himself a 'freak of nature' and lamenting his condition.
Determined not to lose Mary Jane, indicating affection and concern for others.
Carefully prepares a complex saline solution using pipette, boiling water, gauze, and other materials, indicating scientific skill and attention to detail.
Internally struggles with feelings of guilt and frustration, doubts his abilities and the value of his powers which affects his confidence.
Responds quickly and assertively when Ditkovich asks if he is okay, showing social awareness and control despite internal turmoil.
Stuffs his Spider-Man costume into a burning steel drum and walks away, not looking unburdened.
Notices a young woman being harassed, experiences discomfort but does not intervene.
Notices threatening behavior toward the young woman and experiences spider sense tingling, indicating alertness and situational awareness.
Does not intervene when the men harass the woman despite feeling discomfort and spider sense alert; looks away when flipped off.
Walks unsteadily across the lot toward the drum, indicating some physical unsteadiness or fatigue.
Sees a man being threatened and robbed by three others, wrestles with whether to intervene, hesitates, but ultimately keeps walking.
Sees a man being mugged but hesitates, taking a deep breath before ultimately walking away.
Poses awkwardly and has fun with his Spider-Man costume, showing a playful and sincere side.
Smiles and shows delight at small personal achievements, indicating good-natured enthusiasm.
Falls down the stairs but is unembarrassed, showing a humble and approachable demeanor.
Calls MJ to ask her out politely and sincerely, showing friendliness and sincerity.
Successfully shoots a clear web strand and uses it to pull his knapsack back, showing control and progress with his powers.
Experiments carefully with his powers, acknowledging 'It's working' and showing persistence and observation.
Poses stiffly and awkwardly in his Spider-Man costume, imitating moves in a parody manner.
Smiles despite falling on his ass from running down stairs, shows lack of embarrassment and self-awareness.
Asks MJ if she plans to see Otto Octavius, showing concern and desire for honesty.
Accepts MJ's refusal and hangs up without argument or hostility.
Runs toward Otto and MJ to intervene despite the danger.
Tells Otto to put MJ down and fights Otto to protect her.
Pauses briefly before intervening, showing hesitation.
Dashes into a souvenir shop, quickly grabs a Spider-Man replica shirt and mask, and dresses on the run to prepare for action.
Hesitates briefly before acting and looks around instead of immediately engaging, showing some caution but also possible uncertainty.
Confronts Otto directly and demands he let go of MJ, showing confidence and assertiveness.
Fights Otto who is holding MJ, but the fight is not fair and he is outmaneuvered as Otto escapes, indicating limits in his current capability.
Relentlessly climbs back onto the train after each fall despite worsening conditions, showing resilience and determination.
Manages to disable Otto's latch mid-battle, which is a tactical move to weaken his opponent.
Webbing sputters when trying to save passengers, indicating some mechanical or physical limitation or fatigue.
Chooses to stay with the out-of-control train instead of chasing Otto, prioritizing the safety of others over a direct pursuit.
Appears visibly winded and tired, signaling physical limits affecting his effectiveness.
He holds MJ when she bursts into tears and strokes her hair.
Reassures MJ by praising her performance sincerely.
Spooked and evasive on the phone when asked about Dr. Octavius.
Acknowledges his faults and tries to apologize sincerely to MJ.
Fails to maintain financial responsibility, wallet is empty when it's time to pay.
Attempts to assist Gibreel with the pizza box problem despite clumsiness.
Pleads sincerely with Mr. Aziz for another chance at work despite being broke.
Throws himself on the hood to stop the robbery, attempts to physically subdue the armed assailant despite personal danger.
Throws himself on the hood to try to stop the robbery, attempts choke-hold, despite being outmatched physically.
Fails to subdue the robber, gets punched and hit over the head, sags to the floor.
Shocked by the sight of his Spider-Man costume, indicating possible hesitation or internal conflict about resuming his role.
Walks into the city room and approaches Betty Brant, expressing hope to be back on the job, showing willingness to re-engage with responsibilities.
Reaches out to Harry with concern, asking what's going on.
May lies to protect Peter and shows anger when Otto threatens her, indicating her protective warmth toward him.
May lies about Peter's whereabouts to protect him, showing awareness of danger and a strategic protective instinct reflecting Peter's complex situation that requires competence.
Absent from scene, not directly acting or responding to Otto’s threats or May’s confrontation, indicating a temporary lapse or failure in immediate competence in managing threats.
Watches the news coverage of Otto Octavius's rampage passively on a small television, without immediate action or reaction.
Avoids opening door initially and struggles to tidy up, showing reluctance to face others but eventually opens for Aunt May.
Panics and switches off the news broadcast showing self-concern or avoidance.
Engages briefly and gratefully with Aunt May who brings him soup and pie despite his current state.
Accepts Aunt May's care, eats soup after days without food.
Shows vulnerability by admitting things haven't been easy and has tears in his eyes.
Struggles to communicate fully with Aunt May, reflecting emotional distance but not hostility.
Eats soup heartily after days without food, showing awareness of his physical state.
Pauses and seems freaked out when hearing that Octopus came looking for Spider-Man, showing alertness to danger.
Engages in honest emotional exchange with Aunt May, showing emotional intelligence.
Expresses frustration and despair openly (e.g., 'I'm so sick of that word [responsibility]'), reflecting internal struggle but also some inability to fully manage his burden.
Expresses emotional struggle and desire for a normal life but lacks clear proactive plans or confident decision-making.
Runs toward the danger zone to help Mary Jane despite police warnings and public criticism.
Hears people criticize Spider-Man and feel responsible but still acts to help.
Quickly arrives at the scene of destruction and tries to get closer despite police restrictions.
Hears bystanders blaming Spider-Man but does not immediately react defensively or try to clarify.
Remains momentarily shocked and passive upon seeing Otto carrying Mary Jane away, hesitating before acting.
Decides to run after Otto immediately after he passes, showing decisive pursuit despite danger.
Shouts for MJ to warn her and tries to stop Ock by throwing a broken beam at him despite the danger to himself.
Takes a truck without permission from the driver to pursue Ock and save MJ.
Attempts to stop Ock by hurling a broken beam at his legs, demonstrating quick thinking and use of available resources.
Is quickly knocked away by Ock’s pod and lands hard, showing he is vulnerable and momentarily overpowered.
Quickly recovers from being hit and immediately pursues Ock by commandeering a truck and driving at top speed in pursuit.
Improvises a web from orange fencing to stop Ock and protect MJ despite its crooked and lame form.
Runs to MJ immediately after Ock is knocked down, showing concern and protective behavior.
Despite being battered and defeated, he shows determination and grit rather than giving up, indicating care and responsibility.
Considers using the pliers on himself to remove the mechanical tentacle, knowing it will hurt but understanding the necessity.
Improvises a web from orange fencing to trip Doctor Octopus, causing him to lose balance and fall.
Despite being tossed aside and outnumbered, tries to free MJ from a pod that has a firm grip on her.
Pulled away by another pod and left alone in the rubble, initially appears defeated but quickly shifts to grim determination.
Considers and then proceeds to stab himself in the hip with a sharp tool to remove a mechanical component or attempt to regain control.
Confronts looters who are harassing a Sikh man and defends him despite personal risk and physical harm.
Attempts to reason with looters by asking one to put back stolen goods before intervening.
Holds up the bloody chip grimly smiling despite injury, finds a bent bicycle and decides to use it to pursue Ock and MJ.
Confronts looters threatening a Sikh man, warns them to put back stolen goods, then drops the bike and runs into them to defend the man.
Engages multiple attackers, is initially overwhelmed but recovers quickly and fights them off efficiently with agility and skill.
Does not use the bicycle more effectively or avoid direct conflict with looters, choosing to run into a gang multiple times on foot.
Breaks into JJJ's office, shatters the Spidey suit case to retrieve the suit.
Makes a sarcastic comment to JJJ ('It makes you look fat.') before leaving.
Breaks into JJJ's office by smashing the skylight, shatters the case holding the Spider-Man suit, and swiftly escapes using his webbing.
Engages in a physically demanding fight with Doc Ock on ice and in the snow, demonstrating agility and power but ultimately gets defeated.
Peter is unconscious and strapped to a torture table, showing vulnerability but no active warmth in the scene.
Remains strapped and passive while Otto prepares a harmful procedure on him and others act around him; no active resistance or attempts to escape or strategize shown in the excerpt.
Allows himself to be shaved bald and restrained by Otto’s machines without resistance.
Maintains presence of mind despite being physically vulnerable and under threat.
Leaps to save MJ by holding up a collapsing roof beam, risking own safety.
Reassures MJ by admitting he loves her even when facing death.
Focuses on saving MJ first and supports her in crisis despite his own fear and exhaustion.
Appears briefly to come into MJ's apartment and notices her need for water, but is leaving rather than staying to help.
Leaves MJ’s apartment while she is in need, not immediately helping her get water.
Admits to loving Mary Jane but rejects being with her due to the danger and uncertainty of his life, showing concern for her wellbeing.
Says he'll call Mary Jane tomorrow before leaving, indicating he still cares and intends to maintain contact despite the difficulties.
Looks up at Mary Jane after she calls out about the forgotten camera, showing attentiveness and responsiveness.
Explains to MJ the dangers and uncertainties of his life and chooses to distance himself to protect her.
Forgets his camera at MJ's apartment.
Quickly reacts and catches MJ when she jumps from the balcony despite physical awkwardness and pain.
